title: UREC Student Employment  · Angelo State University
description: UREC is always looking for students interested in working in a fun and challenging environment.

paragraphs: University Recreation employs over 200 students throughout the school year who are interested in working in a fun and challenging environment.
Employees must be currently enrolled Angelo State University students, customer-first focused, responsible, and professional when enforcing UREC policies. Benefits of UREC Student Employment:
Select a job below to apply.
Would you like to know more about each position within UREC? Simply expand the boxes below to learn more about the positions within each division.
LifeguardQualifications/Duties: Supervise the indoor swimming pool. Current lifeguarding certification preferred, not required.Days/Times: 20 hours per week; some weekends and holidays required.
Water Safety InstructorQualifications/Duties: Plan, coordinate and teach learn-to-swim and water safety coursesDays/Times: Up to 16 hours per week; summer only

Operational SupervisorQualifications/Duties: Supervise the part-time staff personnel and uphold all facility rules and guidelines. At least one year of UREC employment is preferred.Days/Times: 20 hours per week; some weekends and holidays required

Welcome Desk AttendantQualifications/Duties: Provide a welcoming environment to Ben Kelly CHP patrons and dispense athletic equipment to patrons.Days/Times: 20 hours per week; some weekends and holidays required

Group Fitness InstructorQualifications/Duties: Group Fitness Instructors are responsible for leading participants through safe and effective fitness classes; certifications are preferred but not required. Certification training will be provided.Days/Times: 5-10 hours per week; some weekends required

Weight Room SupervisorQualifications/Duties: The Weight Room Staff is responsible for ensuring the safety of participants and maintenance of equipment through vigilant supervision of the facility.Days/Times: 10-20 hours per week; some weekends required
SupervisorQualifications/Duties: The Intramural Supervisor is responsible for on-site supervision of intramural sports.Days/Times: 20 hours per week; some weekends required

Intramural Sports OfficialQualifications/Duties: The officials are to enforce the rules of the governing body of each individual major sport.Training scheduleDays/Times: 20 hours per week; some weekends required

Camp InstructorQualifications/Duties: Camp UREC Instructors will work directly with children by organizing and supervising general activities or specialize in teaching campers topics such as basketball, soccer, softball, football and volleyball.Days/Times: 20 hours per week

Adventure Education InstructorQualifications/Duties: Open Lake House Facility for general-use hours, instruct clinics and team building events, assist participants in the climbing gym and with OA related equipment check out.Days/Times: 20 hours per week; some weekends and holidays required
Adventure Education SupervisorQualifications/Duties: Assist participants in climbing gym area and supervise staff.Days/Times: 20 hours per week; some weekends and holidays required
Office Assistant (WORK-STUDY ONLY)Qualifications/Duties: General office dutiesDays/Times: 20 hours per week

Graduate Assistant positions provide graduate students with an excellent opportunity to become a practitioner within the recreation industry. An assistantship within UREC helps equip the employee with tools and experiences that may be relevant in any industry.
Graduate Assistant Job Descriptions
Check the Current Student Job Postings section above to find and apply for open positions.
Visit theHuman Resourcespage for a complete list of forms and policies for student employees.
